title: [feature request]Does all nn.functional support backprop?
body_html:
I wonder that do all functions in torch.nn.functional support backprop?

For example, can the stacked structure net1 -> midresults -> torch.nn.functional.bilinear -> net2 -> outputs be correctly trained end-to-end?

By the way, forum disscuss.pytorch.org is unable to connect, how to deal with that?
body_text:
I wonder that do all functions in torch.nn.functional support backprop?
For example, can the stacked structure net1 -> midresults -> torch.nn.functional.bilinear -> net2 -> outputs be correctly trained end-to-end?
By the way, forum disscuss.pytorch.org is unable to connect, how to deal with that?
body:
I wonder that do all functions in `torch.nn.functional` support backprop?

For example, can the stacked structure `net1 -> midresults -> torch.nn.functional.bilinear -> net2 -> outputs` be correctly trained end-to-end?

By the way, forum `disscuss.pytorch.org` is unable to connect, how to deal with that?
